Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies and the Miami Marlins meet Sunday in MLB action from LoanDepot Park.
This will be the final installment in a four-game series.
The Phillies took on the Toronto Blue Jays this week and won both games 10-9 and 4-2.
The Phillies won their first two games against the Marlins 5-2 and 16-2.
In Saturday’s game, the Phillies were out-hit 14-11 in a wild loss 9-5.
Starter Aaron Nola gave up four earned runs in 4.2 innings.
Seth Johnson will make his MLB debut as the starter for the Phillies on Sunday.
The Marlins played the Washington Nationals in their last set and managed to split those two games.
The Marlins scored three runs in the seventh inning and held on for the victory in game three against the Phillies.
Max Meyer will start for the Marlins on Sunday. So far Meyer is 3-5 with a 5.68 ERA in 11 starts.
Five of the last six games between the Phillies and Marlins at LoanDepot Park have gone OVER the total runs line.
Six of the Phillies' last eight road games against NL East opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 OVER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the last six games between the Phillies and Marlins.
The 'Inning 1 OVER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Phillies' last five road games.
